name: Crowne Plaza Liverpool City Centre

reviews.text: I booked the Crowne Plaza in Liverpool for a girls weekend. Having previously lived in Liverpool I knew the location about 0.5mile from the Albert Dock and 0.5 mile from the city centre would be great! It was a perfect location if you are looking for a hotel close to all the attractions and which is easy to get to. When we arrived we were informed by recpetion that the room we had paid for (with 2 double beds in it) was unavailable as they had overbooked their guests into the hotel that weekend. They did not offer me a suggestion as to how they were going to resolve this issue until I said that it was their problem to deal with as I had paid for that room. They offered me a room with a double bed and said they would put a z-bed in it. In that situation they told me they could do no more. When we got to the room the bar manager was stood waiting with the z-bed and he was the one who put it up and made the bed. The bedding which was put on was dirty (it had black marks all over it!) so the bar manager had to go and find more sheets to put on the bed. I must say he was very pleasant and offered my friend and I a complimentary glass of wine each for the inconvenience. On inspection of the room we found there were 2 complimentary bottles of water in the room, one of which had been drunk by the previous occupant and not replaced before our arrival! The bathroom had hair all on the tiles around the bath which was a bit horrid to have to clear up and the blanket on the bed was stained and dirty. We used the pool facilities on our second day and these were clean and tidy, although we were slightly dubious when we heard a complaint that someone was shaving in the sauna! Nice! The morning of check out we had an express check out form slipped under our door stating that if we wanted express check out we just needed to write our credit card details on the form. This would have been fine apart from when I read the bill they had charged us for 2 nights accommodation, which I had already paid for when I booked the room(!) and a bottle of white wine from the minibar which we never even touched(!). In the hotel's defence they were fairly quick to sort out the bill once I told them of the problems. There was a distinct lack of communication though as they were talking about our stay in a room with 2 double beds and I had to tell them about what had happened when we checked in. In conclusion, the hotel itself was very nice and in a very good location however I believe it was just poorly run and the standards were slipping. We paid a lot of money for the hotel and this was not reflected in the standards of the hotel. I would be reluctant to use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Good location but poorly run

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 1 night after watching the Evita musical in the Empire. The hotel is about 5 minutes away from the Empire Theatre in a cab.There are some nice restaraunts to everyones taste close to the Empire.Our family room was clean and airy had a standard hotel bathroom which was clean.The room also had a flat screen television. The room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the Mersey but there was major building work going on thankfully there was no noise because it was a saturday night and no work on the Sunday.The hotel staff were very helpful and polite,The breakfast was excellent,the cooked breakfast was warm and fresh-very tasty! There was also a lot of choice for a non meat eater as wel.Within walking distance of Albert Dock and the main street and new shopping complex Liverpool1.I would recommend this hotel if you want to to discover Liverpool or somewere to stay if your watching a musical.The hotel is suitable for all ages.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The clean room,polite staff and excellent breakfast
likes.disliked: — Car park was small and expensive

reviews.text: Three couples were going to the Isle of Man for a long weekend and decided to treat ourselves to an overnight stay before catching the ferry so booked in the Crowne Plaza. Huge tip - book last minute - 2 couples booked months in advance and the other couple last minute - they had their room for more than £20 less!
reviews.title: Pay to park your car?!?

likes.liked: — The ice machine and the proximity to the port for our ferry to the Isle of Man

reviews.text: Check-in was okay. Our room was acceptable (usual one night stay standard) - two comfortable double beds, nice flat screen television, bathroom clean and tidy with nice shower, lovely fluffy towels, tea and coffee making facilities and an ice making machine on the floor down by the lifts (perfect for our G & T's).
reviews.title: Largest Pool in Liverpool, Great Location

reviews.text: The bar service was verging on the poor and the prices, as usual for hotels, expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent as always

reviews.text: Our family group (9 adults and 4 children) stayed att his hotel to celebrate my father-in-law's 90th birthday. The hotel staff were superb from start to finish, ensuring that my father-in-law received special attention, a specially allocated room, and that he received every possible assistance throughot his stay. All of the rooms were well equipped and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with excellent staff who could not have been more helpful, more courteous and more efficient.

reviews.text: My wife and I, as veterans of far too many lukewarm hotel breakfasts, had to admit that the hotel's boast of serving "the best breakfast in town" was probably an underestimate- it was very hot and there was an excellent variety of choice!! Our celbration meal in the hotel restaruant was also first class, with the added bonus that hotel staff took it upon themselves to make sure that the young children in the party received their food early in the proceedings.
reviews.title: You could be any in hotel chain in any city....

reviews.text: All in all an excellent weekend due in no small part to the very professional, courteous and ever helpful attitudes displayed by every member of the hotel staff.
reviews.title: Comfortable, friendly hotel, excellent standards and really helpful staff

reviews.text: In the light of this experience at least three of our family groups are planning a return visit to this hotel early next year.
reviews.title: Top Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checked in at this hotel for two nights with a gentleman who didn't really show any customer service skills (everyone else we dealt with were very pleasant).
reviews.title: Expensive stay
Good location
reviews.text: First the positive things: It has a good location, reasonable rates for what you get, good rooms and staff are very friendly and always willing to help. Not so positive things: though you find everything at breakfast it is not high quality and while we were there, the lobby was busy morning and afternoon every day with outsiders coming for convention meetings and there is really no-where to sit or stand and also very noisy at night with large groups of male football supporters staying.
Also, the windows are screwed shut so you can never get fresh air and quite a few of the bathroom tiles were cracked.
reviews.title: Worst Crowne Plaza i've ever visited..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saying all that, I would go back, but before I will check if there are any conventions or football matches going on during my stay.
reviews.title: A New Year Break To Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay at a lot of IHG hotels and was quite keen to visit this property for the first time. i was looking forward to what should have been an enjoyable stay, but ultimately, this hotel is not worthy of the Crowne Plaza brand.
reviews.title: Fantastic New Year's Eve bash!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you hold Platinum status with Priority Club, then don't expect any recognition here. My enquiry about an upgrade was met with a pained expression from the guy at the front desk. Not possible. What about club lounge access? Not possible either, because the lounge was "full". I walked past the lounge at around 8.30pm and there were 2 people in there.
reviews.title: New Year's Eve.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought we would try a change for our many trips to Liverpool; we usually stay at Hope Street Hotel but we were going to a concert at Echo arena and decided on a change choosing the Crowne Plaza. We wont choose it again. Poorly trained bar staff service exceptionally expensive bar drinks (including espresso in a freezing cold cup without sugars etc.... cold by the time you have hynted some out, astronomical pricing for drinks and although this would be accetpable if the service thatcame with it was adequate you woundn't mind so much but it was very poor.
reviews.title: Would not recommend at all.

reviews.text: Breakfast barely acceptable for a 4* hotel, typical bain-marie fodder in a very very cold room; diners eating breakfast with coats on. Rooms nothing special at all and general cleanliness was not good; like they hadn't had time to clean after their more important Conference guests.
reviews.title: Simply The Best !

reviews.text: When our terrible bar experience was mentioned to the recetion staff in the morning the drinks were taken off the bill and although the gentleman dealing with our issue was courteous, his manager (standing next to him) didn't even raise his head.
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.text: I own a small country inn and would be appaulled if customers left unhappy; we did, we wont be returning or recommending this place at all. A shameful hotel for such a fabulous city.
reviews.title: Liverpool - I will be back!

reviews.text: Choose here for a soulless conference but not if you want to experience Liverpool's better points.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Spent two nights while on a Beatles tour in Liverpool. Hotel facilities were well kept. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was also well sized but there seemed to have been a drainage problem in the bathroom because none of the water went down in the bath tub. It could've been that we didn't know how to work the drain...
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Room had a nice view of the harbor. Bed was unbelievably comfortable...wanted to take it home with me. Fluffy robes were provided in each room and some complimentary water was also provided.
reviews.title: You have found your hotel in Liverpool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a wedding going on the night we were there which didn't bother me, but the couple we were traveling with mentioned that it kept them up at night.
reviews.title: Really Good

reviews.text: Front desk staff was very helpful with restaurant and tour reservations. Would stay again if we visit Liverpool.
reviews.title: Needs cleaning

likes.liked: — The breakfast and internet in the club lounge

reviews.text: This is a good hotel and very reasonable price-wise!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been looked after much better

likes.disliked: — Car park fee and view from bedroom window of drained dock.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here a few times and really like this hotel. We tend to stay every NYE (have done so for the last 4 years), since we like to be near to the Liver Building, to bring in the New Year by the Mersey.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was swift and efficient and the room was as good as ever. We were a bit concerned about potential noise from the NYE reception but we went to bed so late ourselves it did not bother us!
reviews.title: New Years Eve to remember

reviews.text: One odd thing this year is that the bar closed at 2 am, even to residents – that is new from what I remember. I think they’ve had issues with non-residents trying to gain entry for all-night drinking so that might explain that. You could order room service if you wanted a drink after that but that might not suit some parties of friends, for example.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room service breakfast on NY day, not wishing to face a scrum downstairs if we went down late (the hotel appeared to be full and we guessed most people would not be up early) and that was fab. We were surprised it arrived right on time, since we expected a delay as they were so busy. We ate breakfast in the restaurant the next day and it is still one of the best hotel breakfasts we’ve ever had.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: There was one disappointment in terms of cleanliness – there was a rogue cotton bud on the bathroom floor that had obviously been missed by the cleaner – but this was certainly not enough to have any impact on our stay; everything else seemed to be really clean.
reviews.title: Good hotel- bad food............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon, after travelling by train to Lime Street (suggest if you don't know Liverpool and travel by train, get a taxi). Met by a friendly doorman, who helped us throughout the weekend with directions/taxis etc. The reception area has a certain wow factor, very open plan, a statue in the centre, pleasant check-in staff.
reviews.title: Comfy rooms, but don't expect a great view right now.

likes.liked: — Access to the club lounge, if you need soft drinks and internet access at weekends
likes.disliked: — The view - not as described on the Crowne Plaza website

reviews.title: Service as good as the promises
reviews.text: We had booked the upgraded package with club room/lounge access. For this you get a supposedly superior view, larger room and access to the club lounge where at the weekends you can help yourself to soft drinks (bitter lemon, orange juice, lemonade and coke), and coffee, Muffins and biscuits are also available. If you stay Tues-Fri, you also get alcohol within certain hours. We used this lounge quite a bit, it was quiet, underused, and had free access to the internet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room looked like any other Crowne Plaza hotel, with large comfortable bed, desk, chair, and flat screen TV. A full size bath, the white company toiletries, good shower pressure, slow to fill bath.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Was in great location 10mins walk from city centre

reviews.text: But it was the view that let this place down (please see photo). Very depressing, and you couldn't even open the window in our room because it had been screwed together (not sure about other rooms, but this was the case in room 310). However, since we did lots of sightseeing, we didn't have much time to look out of our window. Air con also was efficient.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on Sunday morning at 10am was so busy we had to wait for a table, but on Monday morning there was hardly anyone around. Great breakfast, hot and eggs done your way (omlette, scrambled poached etc,.). Great staff in the restaurant for breakfast as well, very quick and efficient on tea/toast/coffee/clearing your table.
reviews.title: very let down by the crowne plaza

reviews.text: My husband and I booked the Crowne Plaza for a get together for 16 friends. From the initial contact with the hotel the staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. Our booking was a little complicated as some friends were arriving on the Friday, some on the Saturday and we wanted to arrange a private dinner on the Saturday.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend!

reviews.text: The hotel did not let us down on any level and everyone had a great weekend! The location is ideal and within walking distance to the centre of Liverpool. I admit that the docks are undergoing a significant transformation at the moment but we saw that as a positive thing and it didn't deter from our stay.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a double room which had such a comfy bed. The room was perfect with the only criticism being a slightly grubby carpet - a minor point. There was an abundance of lovely soft towels in the bathroom along with 2 bathrobes.
reviews.title: Close to the Mersey

reviews.text: We had heard a couple of negative points re the food but I have to say the private dinner we had on the Saturday was outstanding and the portions very generous. I can't say enough about the staff over the whole weekend. Everytime we sat down in the lounge someone was there right away to take a drinks order with a smile and ask us how we were.
reviews.title: very nice

likes.disliked: — bar service and staff - slow and not helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband used the leisure facilities and he was pretty impressed. I have booked this hotel again in July for a friend and I to attend a concert and I am looking forward to returning.
reviews.title: Very Nice

description: The Crowne Plaza Hotel Liverpool is located in the heart of this vibrant city with fantastic views of the river and the iconic Royal Liver building. You will find comfort and luxury at one of the most central and desirable locations in Liverpool.The Crowne Plaza Hotel is near Anfield, home of Liverpool FC, The Beatles Museum, Liverpool 1 and a 10 minute riverside walk from the Echo Arena and BT Convention Centre. Enjoy modern dining in The Plaza Brasserie or your favorite drink in 'The Lounge', our bright and airy atrium is ideal for relaxing or informal meetings with wireless internet access. From the best breakfast in town , to feasting on fabulous food in the evening, our team look forward to welcoming you.Our spacious air conditioned bedrooms most with river views and free internet access, provide you with outstanding comfort. Why not treat yourself to the benefits of a Club room. Eygtian cotton linen on a king sized bed, stunning river views, and exclusive membership to our club lounge, provide you with guaranteed luxury.Our unique meeting and event facilities accommodate up to 500 people and with the convenience of our own secure and well lit on site car park.We can help you put fun in your day in our Leisure club enjoy a swim in our large pool, the bubbles of the spa, or energise in our fully equipped gymnasium.
